page.title: 19SYNOPSIS OF INTERVIEWS
page.content: More women than men said that there were problems when the motorway was built. The noise and lights at night led to a protest which restricted work from 7 a.m. to 9 p.m. Of the twelve who answered the questions, 3 liked it there, while the rest were ambivalent or did not like it. Traffic noise was mentioned by 9 residents. After 14 years they do not seem to be getting used to it. One also complained of the smoke. They did not have many problems with their own children, but all seem to warn other children of the dangers of playing near the motorway. Six people do not have pets; the others keep their animals away from the road or train them well.
